newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks end last session of 1996/97 lower.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks end last session of 1996/97 lower.

text.p: Japanese stocks closed moderately lower on Monday, the last day of the 1996/97 fiscal year, amid worries about the strength of Japan's economic recovery and the impact of tighter U.S. monetary policies.
But the Nikkei index managed to claw back above the key 18,000 level just before the close, paring its losses.
The 225-share average ended 1.02 percent or 186.32 points down at 18,003.40 after slumping by more than two percent in late trading, as futures-related sales weighed on prices.
